title: Drawing, "Sincholagua, Morning, from the Temple of the Sun, Quito", June 24, 1857
medium: Brush and white gouache, pencil on buff paper
description:
Top:  The cloud- capped Carambe rises over cloud banks and ranges.  Written: "Morning snow peak to the extreme North from Quito No.1/ Morning"
Bottom: A summit rises from a range.  Both are snow-capped.  Caption: "4th (3d struck out) peak of perpetual snow counting from the north Sinchulagua/ Morning"

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sincholagua, Morning, from the Temple of the Sun, Quito", June 24, 1857.
June 24, 1857. Brush and white gouache, pencil on buff paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-218.
